metadata.Title: CVE-2023-4527 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in glibc. When the getaddrinfo function is called with the AF_UNSPEC address family and the system is configured with no-aaaa mode via /etc/resolv.conf, a DNS response via TCP larger than 2048 bytes can potentially disclose stack contents through the function returned address data, and may cause a crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4527` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
libc-bin - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
libc6 - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
libc6-amd64 - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
libc6-i386 - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
libc6-prof - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
libc6-s390 - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
libc6-x32 - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
locales - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
locales-all - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
nscd - 2.37-0ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> no-aaaa was introduced in 2.36 by: https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commitdiff;h=f282cdbe7f436c75864e5640a409a10485e9abb2 system needs to be configured in no-aaaa mode in resolv.conf

criterions.comment: glibc package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.37-0ubuntu2.1').
